title: D'Amico Risk Classification for Prostate Cancer
desc: The D'Amico Risk Classification for Prostate Cancer assesses 5 year failure of treatment based on clinical factors.

orgreference.text: D'Amico AV, Whittington R, Malkowicz S, et al. Biochemical Outcome After Radical Prostatectomy, External Beam Radiation Therapy, or Interstitial Radiation Therapy for Clinically Localized Prostate Cancer. JAMA.1998;280(11):969-974. doi:10.1001/jama.280.11.969.

other_refer.text: Rodrigues G, Warde P, Pickles T, et al. Pre-treatment risk stratification of prostate cancer patients: A critical review. Canadian Urological Association Journal. 2012;6(2):121-127. doi:10.5489/cuaj.11085.
Moul JW. The Evolving Definition of Advanced Prostate Cancer. Reviews in Urology. 2004;6(Suppl 8):S10-S17

data.evidence: Risk calculated by combination of above factors.
data.facts:
Low risk:

  • Gleason Score <6 and
  • PSA <10 ng/ml and
  • Clinical stage T1c or T2a

Intermediate risk:

  • Gleason Score of 7 or
  • PSA of 10-20 ng/ml
  • Clinical stage T2b

High risk:

  • Gleason Score >8 or
  • PSA >20 ng/ml or
  • Clinical stage T2c or T3
